items.title: Market participants raise concerns over BSE's liquidity-based fee structure; exchange says compliant with SEBI norms
items.description: Some participants have raised concerns about BSEs fee structure based on liquidity of the stocks, calling it discriminatory against X, XT category of stocks and adding high cost of transactions for investors of such category of shares. BSE denied the allegations and said this practice is there since 2016, to discourage investors from investing in such low liquid stocks.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continued their buying on second day as they purchased equities worth Rs 1,992 crore on June 9, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) also extended their buying on the 15th day as they bought equities of Rs 3,503 crore on the same day.

items.title: Research analysts cannot provide research for products that they distribute due to potential conflict of interest: SEBI
items.description: SEBI has issued FAQs post amendment in research analyst regulations. The intent is to clarify various aspects of the regulation so that market intermarries are clear and do not violate the regulations. SEBI had last issued such FAQ. SEBI has sought public comments by June 30.

items.title: HDFC AMC, other AMC stocks see profit booking post-May AMFI data
items.description: AMC stocks: While inflows into equity mutual funds declined, the monthly inflows into mutual funds through SIP route rose to a fresh high of Rs 26,688 crore in May.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty rangebound after 4 straight days of rally | Closing Bell
items.description: Bulls Stumble after 4 days of Rally. Nifty choppy but stays above 25,100. Broader indices outperform benchmarks. Smallcaps March for 7th Day in a Row. India Vix sees sharp cool off, down 4%. It Stocks Surge for 5th Day. Nifty Realty Top Sectoral Laggard. Bank Nifty Fizzles Out After 4 Days. Nifty 50 Gainers: Grasim, Drl, Tech Mah. Nifty 50 Losers: Trent, Asian Paints, Bajaj Finance. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Mutual funds are flexing in IPO anchor books and QIB portions, thanks to record SIP flows
items.description: In the anchor segment too, the average share of bids of mutual funds has risen significantly in the last few years, from less than 30 percent in 2021 to an average share of nearly 36 percent in IPOs, though it dipped compared to last year.

items.title: Swiggy, Eternal shares fall for 2nd day amid jitters over Rapido's potential foray into food delivery
items.description: Food delivery giants Swiggy and Zomato may face a valuation cut in the tune of 20% if Rapido manages to execute well after entering the segment, according to Karan Taurani, Executive Vice President at Elara Capital.

items.title: L&T wins major orders for its power transmission & distribution business
